parts: I have a solidjs website with a side navbar. I want to add a FAQ index to the sidebar when the active tab is the FAQ. The activeTab is a signal. How do I get the value to add the FAQ index
flattened: I have a solidjs website with a side navbar. I want to add a FAQ index to the sidebar when the active tab is the FAQ. The activeTab is a signal. How do I get the value to add the FAQ index

parts: Make the FAQ index a conditional addendum to the sidebar
flattened: Make the FAQ index a conditional addendum to the sidebar

parts: I  have the navbar in a separate component and pass in activeTab and setActiveTab.  How do I pass those in from App
flattened: I  have the navbar in a separate component and pass in activeTab and setActiveTab.  How do I pass those in from App

parts: Type error: activeTab is not a function
flattened: Type error: activeTab is not a function

parts: Please share your code so I can review it and help you resolve the issue!
flattened: Please share your code so I can review it and help you resolve the issue!

parts:
The code `` in your `App.js` is correct for passing the `activeTab` and `setActiveTab` signals as props to the `Navbar` component. ### Key Points to Check: 1. **Signal Usage**: - In SolidJS, `activeTab` is a signal, so it must be accessed as `props.activeTab()` in the `Navbar` component to retrieve its value. 2. **Signal Update**: - To update the signal, use `props.setActiveTab("value")`. Here’s how your `Navbar` component should handle these props: --- ### Updated `Navbar` Component ```javascript function Navbar(props) { const faqIndex = [ "What is this site about?", "How can I contact support?", "Where can I find more information?", ]; return (
    {/* Updating the signal using props.setActiveTab */}
  • props.setActiveTab("Home")}>Home
  • props.setActiveTab("FAQ")}>FAQ
  • props.setActiveTab("Contact")}>Contact
{/* Conditional rendering based on props.activeTab() */} {props.activeTab() === "FAQ" && (

FAQ Index

    {faqIndex.map((item) => (
  • {item}
    • ))}
)}
); } export default Navbar; ``` --- ### Explanation: 1. **Passing Props**: - In your `App.js`, `activeTab` and `setActiveTab` are passed correctly as props. ```javascript ``` 2. **Accessing Props in Navbar**: - Use `props.activeTab()` to retrieve the current value of the signal. - Use `props.setActiveTab("value")` to update the signal value. 3. **Dynamic Rendering**: - The FAQ index is displayed only when `props.activeTab()` equals `"FAQ"`. If you’re still seeing a `TypeError`, ensure: - **No typo exists** (e.g., `props.activeTab` vs. `props.activeTab()`). - The `Navbar` component is importing/exporting correctly. If your full code differs significantly or includes additional context, please share it so I can refine this further!

parts:
Your code for the `Navbar` component is mostly correct, but there's a small issue with how you're accessing `props`. Specifically, you have `props.props.setActiveTab` in one place, which is incorrect. You should directly use `props.setActiveTab`. Here's the corrected code: ### Corrected Navbar Code ```javascript
  • props.setActiveTab('main')}>Main
  • props.setActiveTab('data')}>Data
  • props.setActiveTab('analytics')}>Analytics
  • props.setActiveTab('visualization')}>Visuals
  • props.setActiveTab('advantage')}>Galyleo Advantage
  • props.setActiveTab('platforms')}>Platforms
  • props.setActiveTab('about')}>About Us
  • props.setActiveTab('case')}>Case Study
  • props.setActiveTab('contact')}>Contact
  • props.setActiveTab('faq')}>FAQ
{/* Conditional rendering based on props.activeTab() */} {props.activeTab() === "FAQ" && (

FAQ Index

  • Foo
)}
``` --- ### Key Fix: - Replaced `props.props.setActiveTab` with `props.setActiveTab`. This ensures you're accessing the `setActiveTab` function correctly, as it is directly passed into the `Navbar` component. ### Why This Fix Works: 1. **Correct Prop Access**: - Using `props
